meanings.definition: The act of applying a new rule or law to past events.
meanings.sent1: The retroactivities of changing the speed limit affected drivers who had already been driving within the old limit.
meanings.sent2: The government's retroactivities in tax laws caused confusion among taxpayers who had already filed their returns.
meanings.sent3: The retroactivities of banning plastic bags made people realize how many they had already accumulated at home.

meanings.sent5: The retroactivities of implementing a new dress code made everyone rethink their wardrobe choices.
